servinfo.title: Inspection of ECM and Its Circuits
servinfo.ptxt: ECM and its circuits can be checked by measuring voltage, pulse signal and resistance with special tool connected.

attention2.ptxt: ECM cannot be checked by itself. It is strictly prohibited to connect voltmeter or ohmmeter to ECM with ECM connectors disconnected from it.

s1.ptxt: Remove ECM (1) from its bracket referring to Engine Control Module (ECM) Removal and Installation .
Connect special tool (A) between ECM and ECM connectors securely.
Check voltage and/or pulse signal using voltmeter (2) and oscilloscope (3).

item.ptxt: As each terminal voltage is affected by battery voltage, confirm that it is 11 V or more when ignition switch is turned ON.
Voltage with asterisk (*) cannot be measured with voltmeter because it is pulse signal. Use oscilloscope for its check if necessary.
Before performed this inspection, be sure to read the Precautions of ECM Circuit Inspection .

entry.ptxt: Heater output of heated oxygen sensor-2 (Bank-1) (if equipped)

item.ptxt: Ignition switch is at ON position and engine coolant temperature is below 100 °C (212 °F).
A/C switch is at ON position while engine is running and A/C refrigerant pressure is below 1300 kPa (188.5 psi).
Ignition switch is at ON position and engine coolant temperature is 102.5 °C (203 °F) or higher.
A/C switch is at ON position while engine is running and A/C refrigerant pressure is 1600 kPa (232 psi) or higher.

s1.ptxt: Remove ECM from its bracket referring to Engine Control Module (ECM) Removal and Installation .

attention2.ptxt: Never touch terminals of ECM itself or connect voltmeter or ohmmeter (2).

s1.ptxt: Connect special tool (A) to ECM connectors (1) securely.

attention3.ptxt: Do not connect the other connector of special tool to ECM.

s1.ptxt: Check resistance between each pair of terminals of special tool connectors as listed in the following table.

item.ptxt: Be sure to connect ohmmeter probe from wire harness side of coupler.
Be sure to turn OFF ignition switch for this check.
Resistance in the following table represents that measured when parts temperature is 20 °C (68 °F).

entry.ptxt: Battery disconnected and ignition switch turned ON
EGR valve (stepping motor No.1 coil) (if equipped)
EGR valve (stepping motor No.2 coil) (if equipped)
EGR valve (stepping motor No.3 coil) (if equipped)
EGR valve (stepping motor No.4 coil) (if equipped)
